title: A Cognitive Account of the Puzzle of Ideography. (arXiv:2305.00296v1 [q-bio.NC])
abstract: In this commentary article to 'The Puzzle of Ideography' by Morin, we put forth a new cognitive account of the puzzle of ideography, that complements the standardization account of Morin. Efficient standardization of spoken language is phenomenologically attributed to a modality effect coupled with chunking of cognitive representations, further aided by multi-sensory integration and the serialized nature of attention. These cognitive mechanisms are crucial for explaining why languages dominate graphic codes for general-purpose human communication.

translated_title: 符号表意的认知解释之谜
translated_abstract: 在这篇对Morin的《符号表意的谜题》的评论文章中，我们提出了一个关于表意符号谜题的认知新解释，它补充了Morin的规范化解释。有效的口语语言规范化被现象学地归因为模态效应与认知表征的块状化，进一步受多感官整合和注意力串行本质的帮助。这些认知机制对于解释为什么语言在通用人类交流中占主导地位至关重要。
tldr: 符号表意的认知机制解释为什么语言在人类交流中占主导地位
en_tdlr: A cognitive explanation for why languages dominate in human communication compared to graphic codes, due to the efficient standardization of spoken language through modal effects, chunking of cognitive representations, multi-sensory integration, and serialized nature of attention.
